titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the F. W. Von Fricken Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:58

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of printed materials and photographs which document the daily activities of American prisoners of war at Stalag III B and the role of Von Fricken as their social welfare officer. F. W. Von Fricken, an officer of the German Supreme Command, served as social welfare officer in charge of American prisoners of war at Stalag III B, Fürstenberg an der Oder, during World War II.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of F. W. Von Fricken, 1995.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: F. W. Von Fricken Papers (MS 1690). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of printed materials and photographs which document the daily activities of American prisoners of war at Stalag III B and the role of Von Fricken as their social welfare officer. F. W. Von Fricken, an officer of the German Supreme Command, served as social welfare officer in charge of American prisoners of war at Stalag III B, Fürstenberg an der Oder, during World War II.

controlaccess.subject: Prisoners of War -- Germany
Prisoners of War -- United States
World War, 1939-1945 -- Prisoners and prisons -- Germany

did.unittitle: Stalagmites: a propaganda brochure pertaining to the program and facilities provided for American prisoners of war [written in part by F. W. Von Fricken under the pseudonym Sergeant Clyde M. Taylor]

Comité International de la Croix-Rouge en Allemagne: certificate of recognition issued by Dr. R. Marti, head of the delegation inspecting Stalag III B, which attests to the favorable treatment afforded the American prisoners of war by Von Fricken
